--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "yurifromtomsk" <neuroevolution@m...>
wrote:
> Recently I tried to evolve network that could implement XOR
operation
> and added one extra input. Algorithm failed in approximately 10
runs.
> It's really weird. As I didn't use NEAT it would be great if someone
> could check this problem out with NEAT.
> 
> Training sample:
> 
> x1  x2  x3   y
> 0    0    0    0
> 0    1    0    1
> 1    0    0    1
> 1    1    0    0

Yuri, 

Did you try the same thing with x3 being all 1's?  It may just be that
the network needs a bias (i.e. an input with a constant value) in
order to solve XOR.  Also, did it work without x3, with only 2 inputs?

ken
